result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin C Raff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges
Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to Washington County.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid as follows:  $11,450.08 to Manage Packaging Systems and $300 to Bid on Equipment.  Restitution to be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid within the first two years of probation and BEFORE any costs/fines.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with the victim/business or their employees listed in the Criminal Complaint.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 4 MONTHS:  To be served non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.  Defendant to report to the Huber Facility by 06:00 p.m. on 04-01-2016.
LAST 5 MONTHS ARE STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.
Court will allow for transfer to Washington County.
AMENDED 04-27-2016:  Court will allow release for child care.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Justin C Raff in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Victim presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  4 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2 Years.
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probation:  3 Years.
Court will allow for transfer to Washington County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victim/business or their employees listed in the criminal complaint
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

RESTITUTION:  $12,050.08 (Breakdown:  $11,450.08 to Manage Packaging Systems and $300 to Bid on Equipment - to be paid before costs or fines) - To be paid within the first 2 years of probation.  CORRECTED 03-31-2016 - $11,750.08 payable to Manage Packaging Systems.
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
9 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
First 4 months to be served.
Court will allow for transfer to Washington County.
Defendant to report to the huber facility by 6:00 pm. on 04/01/16
Last 5 Months STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion.
